Job Title: Content Creator

Location: Minnesota, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Public Relations, Writing/Editing

Description:
Put Your Heart to Work! 

At AbleLight, we believe the world shines brighter when people with developmental disabilities achieve their full potential. We pioneer life-changing services that empower the people we serve to thrive.

The Content Creator is responsible for creating content for a variety of platforms and needs, including websites, social media, video scripts, marketing materials and newsletters. This role will work to strengthen the brand by providing a consistent voice and engage all external AbleLight audiences to our mission.

 Requirements: 

 Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, Journalism, or related discipline.  3 years of relevant experience.  Understanding and knowledge of AP guidelines, SEO principles and basic graphic design best practices.  Excellent writing and proofreading skills.  Experience writing for different channels including web, email, print, social media, etc.  Skilled at distilling complex concepts and language into content that is easily understood.  Strong storytelling skills with the ability to elicit emotion and a compelling ask.  Collaborates well in teams with ability to consolidate and resolve competing feedback.  Strong research capabilities.  Adobe Creative Suite and/or basic Graphic Design skills.  Ability to meet deadlines and work under pressure while maintaining a professional attitude.  Ability to grasp new concepts quickly and learn about the industry and the audience.  Ability to develop working knowledge of our programs and services to understand how the people we support, and their families may experience our services.  Work from home position, with residency in one of our states of operations: (Wisconsin, California, Colorado, Kansas, Minnesota, Missouri, Oregon, or Washington). 

 Benefits: 

We support the whole person and have designed our benefits with you and your family's total well-being in mind:

 Health and Wellness: Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits starting the first of the month following 30 days of employment and access to Teladoc.  Financial Wellness: 403(b) Retirement Savings Plan with 3.5% matching contributions, Health Savings Account, Flexible Savings Account, and Basic Life, AD&D, STD, and LTD insurance  Work/Life Balance: Paid Time Off (PTO), Tuition Reimbursements  We are now also offering Any Day Pay. With Dayforce Wallet, you get access to your pay as soon as you've earned it at no additional cost to you. 

 Responsibilities: 

 Planned Marketing Content: 

 Originating engaging marketing content for blogs, eBooks, email campaigns, case studies, stories, video scripts, infographics, collateral, and other assets. 

 Planned and unplanned operations goals: 

 Writing, reviewing, editing, and updating content to support AbleLightâ€™s operational goals and promote programs and services. 

 Donor Content: 

 Work with the Advancement Team to develop compelling content to engage donors through donor cultivation, solicitation, and stewardship efforts. 

 Process: 

 Working with marketing team and internal partners to define content needs and story opportunities and maintaining a content calendar that schedules and syndicates efforts. 

 Research: 

 Conducting research on any given topic and track industry statistics aligned to our Case for Support 

 Brand: 

 Helping to create and maintain style guides to ensure they are consistent and clear. Editing content to ensure voice, grammar and style is on point and aligned to the AbleLight brand. 

 Be part of a team who enhances the lives of our individuals in every way possible. Apply today and make a difference in your community! 

BLC123

Apply Now

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
